snippet: Knedliky Laznicka (Dukelskych hrdinu 15), the city's first shop dedicated to dumplings, opened last summer, quickly developing a loyal following that lines up for blocks to buy them.
abstract: Knedliky Laznicka (Dukelskych hrdinu 15), the city's first shop dedicated to dumplings, opened last summer, quickly developing a loyal following that lines up for blocks to buy them.
lead_paragraph: Most Czechs can't live without their dumplings, or knedliky. The dish, which is akin to sliced bread,  usually accompanies a pork or another meat entrée and is a staple on almost all restaurant menus, or at least all the ones offering "original Czech cuisine" in Prague.

headline.main: In Prague, Traditional Dumplings Take Over a Menu
